column4: Hi, I'm having trouble with the final stage of installation. Whenever I restart and select Ubuntu from the menu it has a black screen with a white rectangle that says I need to have 1600x1200@60hz for the video settings. I have double-checked these but I keep getting the error!
is the system a laptop or branded pc?
is it branded or is it a home build?
is it for instance a Dell or a Sony desktop system?
look around the system, it will tell you
aspire doesn't narrow it down enough. We need the model
what model sysyem is the Acer, or what video card are you using??
ok well try adding the bootoption: nomodeset   may help
because if it's an nvidia chip you may need to blacklist the nouveau driver using boot options
if you could have told me the model I could have easily websearched to see if it was an nvidia then advised the bootoption
which is why I was asking the model
those 2 are great for troublesome nvidia cips, once you get the proprietary driver installed then all will be well
About the 'noveau.blacklist=1' thing you told me about, where do I put that?
doesn't matter, its the same difference
